frame.name: Commutation
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Executive_authority</fen> exchanges one penalty, the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>, for another less severe one, the <fen>New_punishment</fen>. The <fen>Offender</fen> is who received the <fen>Original_punishment</fen> is usually expressed as a modifier.
<ex><fex name="zei">On December 15, 1971</fex>, <fex name="exe">Governor Winfield Dunn</fex> conditionally <t>commuted</t> <fex name="ori">his sentence</fex> <fex name="new">to twenty years</fex>.</ex>
<ex>On December 15, 1971, Governor Winfield Dunn conditionally <t>commuted</t> <fex name="off">his</fex> sentence to twenty years.</ex>
<ex>She served about two years before <fex name="exe">President Carter</fex> <t>commuted</t> <fex name="ori">her sentence</fex>.</ex> <ex>She served about two years before President Carter <t>commuted</t> <fex name="off">her</fex> sentence.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Offender
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual who was convicted of a crime and given a sentence (the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>).
<ex> Some of the more interesting points to me include the description of Thomas More's original sentence before it was <t>commuted</t> to beheading</ex> <ex> Some of the more interesting points to me include the description of <fex name="off">Thomas More's</fex> original sentence before it was <t>commuted</t> to beheading</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Executive_authority
FE.definition:
<def-root>The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to commute punishments.
<ex>Hearst was sentenced to seven years in prison. 1979, <fex name="exe">President Jimmy Carter</fex> <t>commuted</t> Hearst's prison sentence after she served nearly two years. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> is responding to in commuting the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>.
<ex> His defence was a good one; but he was convicted and sentenced to death, <t>commuted</t> <fex name="exp">on account of his influence at court</fex> to having his sword broken over his head .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Original_punishment</fen> is commuted.
<ex>Israel <fex name="zei">yesterday</fex> <t>commuted</t> the lengthy prison terms of seven Jews convicted of murdering or plotting to kill Arabs.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Original_punishment
FE.definition:
<def-root>The punishment the <fen>Offender</fen> was originally sentenced to.
<ex>I had learned after all of this period of time has passed the court was about to let (Bush) pay a sum of money and <t>commute</t> <fex name="ori">her sentence</fex> to time served. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: New_punishment
FE.definition:
<def-root>The new reduced form of punishment that the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> orders for the <fen>Offender</fen>.
<ex>he bench comprising Justice Tariq Pervez and Justice Ijazul Hassan <t>commuted</t> his sentence <fex name="new">to 10-year rigorous imprisonment</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the commutation which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>) and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Executive_authority</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously</ment>, <ment>coldly</ment>, <ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action performed by the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> that accomplishes the commutation.
<ex>The governor may <t>commute</t> the sentence <fex name="mea">by committing the person who may benefit from programs offered at a youth correctional facility to the department of corrections until the youth is 18 years of age or until sooner placed or discharged</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: commute.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: reduce (a judicial sentence, especially a sentence of death) to a less severe one

lexUnit.name: commutation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: he action or process of commuting a judicial sentence or a legal obligation or entitlement
